discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C. Within the Customer Portal, update Show Resource Phone to Yes: This enables the portal to display the technician’s phone number for all customers, assuming the data is present.
D. Verify that the Main Phone field is populated: This confirms the technician’s phone number is entered in their resource record, making it available for display.
A, B and E are customer record items but the question is about the technicians phone number. Remains C and D (though for D i wonder if the main phone is practical.)

questions.question_text:
A customer experience manager wants to share a technician's phone number with a customer. The customer needs to be able to see the phone number in the customer experience portal and be able to communicate directly with the technician.

The customer reports that they are not able to see the phone number in the portal.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.E: Ensure the customer's communication preference is set to Allowed.
choices.B: Ensure the customer's Communication Type is set to Both.
choices.A: Verify that the customer is not on the exclusion list.
choices.D: Verify that the Main Phone field is populated.
choices.C: Within the Customer Portal, update Show Resource Phone to Yes.

questions.question_text:
Your organization recently implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service. In preparation for user training, you created two new tabs on the schedule board, and configured them based on the line of business.

You need to ensure that users know how to control access to those newly created tabs.

Which three sharing options are available for the tabs? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: Available only to the users with Field Service administrator security role.
choices.C: Available only to the users with Field Service dispatcher security role.
choices.B: Available only to the user who created it.
choices.A: Available to all schedule board viewers.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABE
A. Available to all schedule board viewers: Public access for all authorized users.
B. Available only to the user who created it: Private to the creator.
E. Available only to specified users: Shared with a custom user list.

C and D overlap conceptually (both role-based) and are less commonly emphasized as standalone sharing options in practice. If forced to choose between them, C (Dispatcher) is more relevant to schedule board usage than D (Administrator), as dispatchers are the primary users of tabs for operational purposes.

questions.question_text:
Your organization wants to use Connected Field Service for Azure IoT Hub to remotely monitor IoT devices and address issues faster to reduce downtime.

As part of the implementation, you install the Connected Field Service solution and configure it to use Azure IoT Hub.

You discover that you are unable to register IoT devices. You need to determine why.

What are two reasons that could be causing this issue? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Prerequisites for the Azure subscription are incomplete.
choices.A: The Connected Field Service solution was installed incorrectly.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
A and B address root setup issues, while C focuses on connectivity post-setup. D is less practical.

B. Prerequisites for the Azure subscription are incomplete: If the Azure subscription lacks a deployed IoT Hub, required permissions, or configured services, registration cannot proceed.

C. Dynamics 365 is disconnected from Azure: If the integration between Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT Hub is broken (e.g., Logic App authentication issues or wrong IoT Hub reference), registration fails.

Selected Answer: CD
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/field-service/cfs-register-devices
When a device does not register, you'll see an error in the Registration Status field of the asset record. For assets with multiple devices, device status will show the error message for each device.

This error may occur if Dynamics 365 is not connected to Azure or if Azure is offline.

questions.question_text:
During User Acceptance Testing, mobile technicians receive the message "Contact your administrator for access to your organization's mobile apps." when logging into the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.

You need to determine which areas to update within the mobile project, so that technicians can see the appropriate information.

What is a possible way to troubleshoot the issue?

choices.C: Select the menu icon on the top left, and toggle Show non-production apps to Yes.
choices.A: Ensure you have the correct security role (Field Service - Offline Resource), and that the security role is assigned to the Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.
choices.B: Update the mobile offline profile to include the users that require access.
choices.D: Update the mobile offline profile to include the correct Field Service security roles.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A addresses the most likely cause: the technicians’ security roles. The "Field Service - Offline Resource" role (or a similar role like "Field Service - Resource") is required for mobile app access, especially for offline use. If technicians don’t have this role, they’re blocked from logging in. The second part ("assigned to the app") is imprecise but could broadly mean ensuring the role aligns with the app’s permissions in the App Module settings. This is a common UAT issue—roles not assigned correctly during testing.

B is relevant only if the app is in offline mode and the profile excludes the users, but the error suggests a login failure, not an offline sync issue. It's a secondary consideration.

C is an end-user action, not an admin troubleshooting step, and doesn’t apply since technicians can’t log in.

D misunderstands Dynamics 365 configuration—offline profiles don't manage security roles.

questions.question_text:
You are configuring settings related to booking status.

You have the following booking status:
1. Arrived On Site, associated with the Field Service status In Progress
2. Repair, associated with the Field Service status In Progress
3. Completed, associated with the Field Service status Completed

You need to anticipate what will happen when a technician updates their booking status on their Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service mobile app.

Which two scenarios will happen by default? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.D: By default, a timestamp is created with every booking status change.
choices.A:
A timestamp is created for Arrived On Site.
It is then overwritten by a new time stamp when the booking status is updated to Repair, as the associated status is still in progress.
This is followed by a new timestamp when the booking status is updated to Completed.
choices.C:
A timestamp is created when the booking status is updated to Arrived On Site.
No timestamp is created for Repair, as the associated status is still in progress.
This is followed by a new timestamp when the booking status is updated to Completed.
choices.B: By default, a timestamp is created only when a booking status change results in a Field Service status change.

comments.content: These options reflect the standard behavior of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service, where timestamps track significant state transitions rather than every individual status update.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
The two scenarios that will happen by default are:

B: By default, a timestamp is created only when a booking status change results in a Field Service status change.

C: A timestamp is created when the booking status is updated to Arrived On Site. No timestamp is created for Repair, as the associated status is still in progress. This is followed by a new timestamp when the booking status is updated to Completed.
correct: default is • Per Field Service Status Change - Create timestamps only when a booking status change results in a field service status change. This setting is the default.
